Topic: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images
actions: The Canvas. Understand setup() vs draw(). Learn createCanvas() and background()

Topic: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images
actions: 2D Shapes. Draw rect()  ellipse()  line()  and triangle()

Topic: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images
actions: Color & Style Explore fill() stroke()  strokeWeight()  and RGB/Hex values

Topic: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images
actions: The Coordinate System. Practice placing shapes relative to each other (the origin is the top-left corner!)

Topic: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images
actions: Custom Shapes  Use beginShape()  vertex()  and endShape()

Topic: Shapes and Space -Goal Get comfortable with the coordinate system and drawing static images
actions: Mini-Project: Create a Self-Portrait or a Robot using only basic shapes and colors

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: Variables Use let to create variables for position (x  y) and size

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: Built-in Variables  Experiment with mouseX and mouseY

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: Basic Animation  Increment a variable (e.g.  x = x + 1) inside draw() to move a shape

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: The random() function-Create jittery movement or random color palettes

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: The map() function -Learn to re-map values (e.g. use mouse position to control a color range)

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: Conditionals (if/else)-Make a ball bounce when it hits the edge of the screen

Topic: Variables and Animation - Goal: Make things move and react to you
actions: Mini-Project  Create an interactive drawing tool (a Paint program) where clicking changes colors

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Loops (for loops). Draw 100 circles with 3 lines of code

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Nested Loops. Create a grid or a patterned wallpaper

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Functions. Learn to wrap your drawing code into a custom function like drawTree(x

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Transformations. Master translate()  rotate() and push()/pop()

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Trigonometry. Use sin() and cos() for smooth  wave-like movement

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Arrays. Store multiple values to keep track of many objects at once

Topic: Efficiency and Logic - Goal: Stop repeating yourself and start organizing
actions: Mini-Project A generative pattern generator. Press a key to  re-roll  a random beautiful grid

Topic: Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer
actions: Object-Oriented Programming (Classes). Build a  template  for an object

Topic: Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer
actions: Multiple Objects. Use an array to manage 50 Bubble or Particle objects

Topic: Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer
actions: Collision Detection. Make objects react when they touch each other

Topic: Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer
actions: Media. Learn loadImage() and image() to bring outside graphics into your sketch

Topic: Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer
actions: Sound. Introduction to the p5.sound library (making noises on click)

Topic: Objects and Complexity-Goal: Think like a programmer
actions: Final Project: Build something complete. Ideas > A simple game (Snake or Pong) - An interactive Music Visualizer. -A  Generative Art Garden  that grows as you move the mouse
